chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)
1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12

result.execSummary:
The defendant Deshon Terre Perry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
BOTH COUNTS: Provide DNA sample, if not already done. Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge due by 05-01-2018. Any additional remaining balance to be paid through collection by the Dept. of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 12-31-2032; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence; with credit for 0 day time served

superMiscConds.notes:
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Under section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with S.J. (DOB: 12-11-2004), A.A. (DOB: 10-01-2002), S.A. (DOB: 12-01-2003) and J.J. (DOB: 12-27-2001), or their parents or siblings, as they were victims and it is in the interest of the public to prohibit contact.
- Court prohibits contact during Confinement and during Extended Supervision.
- Defendant may not cannot engage in an occupation or participate in a volunteer posisition that requires them to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of agent.
- Defendant may not work or volunteer at any school where there are children under the age of 19.
- Defendant may not work or volunteer at any daycare.
- Defendant may not access any website with ANY pornographic material.
- Defendant may not access any website that offers dating or escort services.
- Defendant may not possess any pornographic material of any kind.
- Defendant may not attend any exotic dance club or strip club.
- Defendant may not live in a place where a child under the age of 19 is present.

- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment.
- Defendant to comply with Sex Offender Registry for a period of LIFE.
- Defendant to complete a Sex Offender Evaluation and any recommended treatment.

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.

supervisions.notes:
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, Court advised defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and the defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extended Supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.

Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s.941.29(1m) or (4m).

Court advised defendant that he is subject to the Sex Offender Registry and must comply with the Sex Offender Reporting requirements. Defendant also advised he may be subject to possible future proceedings as a Sexually Violent Person under Wisconsin Statutes Chapter 980.

Court advised the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under 941.291.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence; with credit for 0 days time served

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deshon Terre Perry

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deshon Terre Perry in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Deshon Terre Perry in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LNR  
Continued Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 2:

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

Defendant is IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge due by 5/1/2018. Any additional remaining balance to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 12/31/2032; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Seek/Maintain full time employment.
- Under section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with S.J. (DOB: 12/11/2004), A.A. (DOB: 10/1/2002), S.A. (DOB: 12/1/2003) and J.J. (DOB: 12/27/2001), or their parents or siblings, as they were victims and it is in the interest of the public to prohibit contact. Court prohibits contact during confinement and during Extended Supervision.
- Defendant may not cannot engage in an occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires them to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age.
- Defendant may work or volunteer at any school where there are children under the age of 19. 
- Defendant may not work or volunteer at any daycare. 
- Defendant may not access any website with ANY pornographic material. 
- Defendant may not access any website that offers dating or escort services. 
- Defendant may not possess any pornographic material of any kind. 
- Defendant may not attend any exotic dance club or strip club.
- Defendant may not live in a place where a child under the age of 19 is present. 
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. 
- Defendant to comply with sex offender registry for a period of LIFE. 
- Defendant to complete a sex offender evaluation and any recommended treatment.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Restitution is set at ZERO. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Court advised the defendant that he is subject to the sex offender registry and must comply with the sex offender reporting requirements;  Defendant also advised he may be subject to possible future proceedings as a Sexually Violent Person under Wisconsin Statutes Chapter 980.

The Court advised the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under 941.291.

Alternative Presentence Investigation Report, received from the defense and filed. LNR
PANEL WAS NOT USED AND WAS SENT BACK TO JURY MANAGEMENT, received and filed. LNR

Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO AMENDED COUNTS 1 & 2:

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

The Court advised the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under 941.291.

Court advised the defendant that he is subject to the sex offender registry and must comply with the sex offender reporting requirements. Defendant also advised he may be subject to possible future proceedings as a Sexually Violent Person under Wisconsin Statutes Chapter 980.

AS TO COUNT 3, 4, 5 & 6:   Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered counts dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.  
Court ordered a presentence investigation without a recommendation pursuant to the State's request. Order for presentence investigation signed and filed. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, any victims, and the defendant. Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. 

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 03/02/2018 at 08:30, branch 17.

Defendant is charged as follows Count 1: Third Degree Sexual Assault, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.225(3), a Class G Felony & Count 2: Third Degree Sexual Assault, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.225(3), a Class G Felony. Case proceeded to plea hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 2, 2018 at 08:30 am.
